What is QUINOPT?¶

QUINOPT (QUadratic INtegral OPTimisation) is an open-source add-on for YALMIP to solve optimisation problems with polynomial quadratic integral inequality constraints. In the simplest form, these have the form

\[\begin{split}\begin{aligned} \min_{\gamma} \quad &c^T \gamma\\ \text{subject to} \quad &\int_a^b Q_{\gamma}(x,u(x),u'(x),...,u^k(x)) \,{\rm d}x \geq 0 \quad \forall u(x) \in \mathcal{H} \end{aligned}\end{split}\]

where \(Q_{\gamma}(x,u(x),u'(x),...,u^k(x))\) is

  1. polynomial in \(x \in [a,b]\)
  2. homogeneous quadratic in \(u(x),u'(x),...,u^k(x)\)
  3. affine the optimization (vector) variable \(\gamma \in \mathbb{R}^s\), and
\[\mathcal{H} := \left\{ u \in C^k([a,b],\mathbb{R}) \quad a_1 u(a) + a_2 u(b) + a_3 u'(a) + \cdots + a_{2k} u^k(b) = 0\right\}\]

is the space of functions that satisfy the \(m\) homogeneous boundary conditions specified through the vectors \(a_0,\,\ldots,\,a_{2k} \in \mathbb{R}^m\).
